sense.name: (cause to) reside
sense.examples: Where are you lodging in Paris? He lodged at one time in Bishopsgate and, later on, in Southwark. He lodged his wife and family at a hotel.

sense.name: (to cause) wedge, implant
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[theme] LODGE PP{P NP[location]}
sense.examples: The penny lodged in her throat. The bullet was lodged at the S2 level. Ask the boy himself to relate it, so that it will lodge in his memory.

sense.name: place, entrust
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] LODGE NP2[theme] PP{P NP[location]}
sense.examples: Where does the Constitution lodge this power? When Pascal sent all mathematicians the challenge, he lodged the prizes and his own solutions with Carcavi.

sense.name: file formally
sense.examples: The White House has lodged a complaint with the Irish embassy in Washington. To receive the dividend, one must lodge the share transfer with the Principal Registrar. Only one claim of ownership has been lodged. Visa applications may be lodged at TT Services.

sense.name: provide lodging for
sense.examples: We are lodging three foreign students this semester. The sacrum lodges the sacral nerves.
